solution_line_template: Jacob earns ${hourly_wage} per hour * {hours_worked} hours = $<<{hourly_wage}*{hours_worked}={earnings_from_job}>>{earnings_from_job} for working.
So he earns ${cookie_price} each * {cookies_sold} = $<<{cookie_price}*{cookies_sold}={earnings_from_cookies}>>{earnings_from_cookies} for the cookies.
He buys a lottery ticket so ${total_earned_so_far} - ${lottery_ticket_cost} = $<<{total_earned_so_far}-{lottery_ticket_cost}={money_after_ticket}>>{money_after_ticket} was left in his money.
After winning in a lottery, he had a total of ${lottery_win} + ${money_after_ticket} = $<<{lottery_win}+{money_after_ticket}={money_after_win}>>{money_after_win}.
He gets ${gift_per_sister} * {num_sisters} per sister = $<<{gift_per_sister}*{num_sisters}={total_gift_from_sisters}>>{total_gift_from_sisters} from her sisters.
